meanings.definition: A magical spirit or being that is typically depicted as living in a lamp and granting wishes.
meanings.sent1: The genie emerged from the lamp and granted three wishes to the kind-hearted boy.
meanings.sent2: I rubbed the lamp, and a genie appeared, ready to fulfill my desires.
meanings.sent3: The genie joked that he could grant wishes, but not the ability to fly without wings.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like having a genie by her side, making everything she touched turn to gold.
meanings.sent5: The genie's blue appearance made him stand out among the other magical creatures.

meanings.definition: A person who is highly skilled or knowledgeable in a particular field.
meanings.sent1: The computer genius fixed my laptop in no time; he was a true genie with technology.
meanings.sent2: She was a marketing genie, able to come up with brilliant strategies effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The cooking genie whipped up a delicious meal in minutes, leaving everyone amazed.
meanings.sent4: His expertise in coding made him a programming genie among his peers.
meanings.sent5: The gardening genie knew exactly how to make plants thrive in any environment.
